definition[0]: to put two people or things together that are related to or suitable for each other
example[0]: The employment agency exists to match up graduates and IT companies.
example[1]: My mother spent her life trying to match me up with various women.
definition[1]: if two things match up, they seem the same or are connected in some way
example[2]: Their accounts just don’t match up.
example[3]: The DNA samples found on her body did not match up with a sample taken from the accused.
definition[2]: to be as good as you hoped, expected etc
example[4]: Unfortunately, the product’s performance did not match up to the manufacturer’s promise.
